result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Durome C Verse not in court.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Durome C Verse. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Defendant's appearance waived. 
Matter set for Defense's Motion to Dismiss. 
Defense gives further statement as to request to dismiss. 
State gives response to motion. 
BTC: MOTION TO DISMISS: DENIED, Court finds there is probable cause.

records.addlTxt: Atty Juan Ramirez
Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim L.M (person, property, residence or family). No contact with 932 Park ave Racine Wi. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Durome C Verse appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez for Durome C Verse appeared by video. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense challenges probable cause of the Domestic Abuse Repeater Enhancer. 
State gives argument to detail probable cause.
Defense gives further argument based on the criminal complaint. 
BTC: Motion to dismiss the Domestic Abuse repeater Penalty Enhancer is denied
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
